entries.meaning: (music) A rearrangement of an older piece of music, possibly including various cosmetic changes.
(music) A piece of music formed by combining existing pieces of music together, possibly including various other cosmetic changes

verbs.description: remix (third-person singular simple present remixes, present participle remixing, simple past and past participle remixed)

examples: Overhauling serves to remix the brine and to shift the meat so that all pieces will be exposed to the brine.

entries.meaning: (music, transitive) To rearrange or radically alter (a particular piece of music).
(transitive) To modify (a work in any medium).
examples: It is essential that we maintain focus on originality as an ethical issue. A broader idea of creativity does not mean that 'anything goes' and sometimes attempts to reuse or remix the work of others becomes an ethical, even a legal, problem  […]
